ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): It is too difficult to make appointments for healthcare visits. During healthcare visits, (you/they) meet with a doctor or other healthcare provider to discuss your health or diagnose, treat, or prevent a medical problem. They can happen in person (for example, by going to a clinic) or remotely (for example, over a video conference).
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) have problems filling out paperwork.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) have trouble getting to (my/their) healthcare visits (e.g., because (I/they) do not have transportation or (I/they) cannot connect remotely).
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) find it hard to handle the waiting room.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Sensory discomforts (for example, the lights, smells or sounds) get in the way of my healthcare. ; [Caregiver Report] Sensory discomforts (for example, the lights, smells or sounds) get in the way of their healthcare.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Concerns about cost or insurance coverage keep (me/them) from getting healthcare.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) cannot find a healthcare provider who will accommodate (my/their) needs.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) do not have enough social, family, or caregiver support to get the healthcare (I/they) need.
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) do not understand the healthcare system.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Fear, anxiety, embarrassment, or frustration keeps (me/them) from getting healthcare.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) have trouble following up on care (for example, going to pharmacy, taking prescribed drugs at the right time, or making a follow-up appointment).

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (I/they) have difficulty understanding what concrete steps (I/they) need to take to improve (my/their) health.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): When (I/they) experience pain and/or other physical symptoms, (I/they) have trouble identifying and reporting them to (my/their) healthcare provider.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Communication with (my/their) healthcare provider or the staff is too difficult.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (My/their) providers or the staff do not include (me/them) in discussions about (my/their) health.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (My/their) behaviors are misinterpreted by (my/their) provider or the staff.

Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): (My/their) providers or the staff do not take (my/their) communications seriously.
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Other
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): None of the above
Which of the follow barriers keep (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: them) from getting good healthcare? (Check all that apply): Other, Please write in
Barriers to Healthcare Checklist - Overall, in the last six months, did the things this survey asked about...
Notes: 1 = Get worse; 2 = Stay about the same; 3 = Get better

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

Number of Healthcare Barriers endorsed
